metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5869 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overrun from integer overflow in array modification

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libecpg6 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpq5 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-14 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-client-14 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plperl-14 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-14 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-14 - 14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-14 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.10-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
